subject: Education
title: Impostor Syndrome: Feeling Fake Despite Evidence
description: Learn Impostor Syndrome: Feeling Fake Despite Evidence in one minute.

hook.text: Seventy percent of people experience impostor syndrome at some point. It hits high achievers hardest.

buildup.text: Impostor syndrome is the persistent belief that your success is due to luck, not competence.

discovery.text: Clance and Imes identified it in 1978 among high-achieving womenâ€”but it spans all demographics.

twist.text: Perfectionists suffer most: their impossible standards guarantee a sense of fraudulence.

climax.text: Normalizing struggle and sharing failure stories in classrooms reduces impostor feelings.

punchline.text: You're not a fraud. You're just learning in public.

quiz.question: What is impostor syndrome?
options: A persistent belief that your success is due to luck rather than real competence
A clinical diagnosis listed in the DSM-5 manual
A condition that only affects students in their first year
